easy.q: I have a tail but I’m not a cat. I tell you numbers with a flick, and I’m found on a clock or math chart. What am I?
easy.hint: It separates whole numbers from part of a whole.

medium.q: I am a word that changes when you add letters at the start or end. If you add ‘re’ I become something you do with a door; if you add ‘un’ I mean not. What word am I?
medium.hint: Think of a base word that can take prefixes to alter meaning.

hard.q: Two friends start at the same time, walk in opposite directions along a straight road, and each takes exactly 3 hours. One walks 1.5 times faster than the other. Who is ahead when they’ve each walked half the distance of the starting points? (Explain briefly.)
hard.a: The faster friend is ahead at halfway, because they cover more distance in the same time; at half the total distance, their lead equals (speed difference) × (time).
hard.hint: Set speeds as v and 1.5v, total distance D. After t = (D/2)/(average speed), compare distances.
